channel.title: Is WinVista any better?
channel.description:
A while back, I downloaded Vista and installed it. This was on build 5384 (a few months ago). I really liked it, I just hated all the compatibility issues (the only driver that worked was for my GPU).
Is it any better now? I'm planning on giving it another try.

item.title: Is WinVista any better?
item.dc:creator: @Zach1188 Zach1188
item.description:
@Zach1188 wrote:

[quote=“frank_, post:5, topic:11719”][quote author=Zach1188 link=topic=17473.msg197997#msg197997 date=1156936307]
I have already dual booted with XP and Vista when it was at build 5384, so I assume that still works. Otherwise you could always use bootmagic.

It’s not too late for you to get it
[/quote]/me cries

but i dont wanna go dual boot atm leel, because i have never attempted to get rid of one of the systems before (should practise before my brother gets home!)

im guessing i r just find a torrent and spend 10 days downloading ^_^[/quote]
It’s not that hard to uninstall an OS as long as you have the CD of the one you want to keep. (Recovery Console > fixmbr)

[quote=“Taylor, post:6, topic:11719”][quote author=frank_ link=topic=17473.msg198002#msg198002 date=1156936469]
im guessing i r just find a torrent and spend 10 days downloading
[/quote]ROFL, what if your folks shut your computer down?[/quote]
Then he just turns his computer on and resumes?

Read full topic
